resources.string:
This app enables you to record your GPS location continuously while walking outdoors and share the data online. It has been designed solely for demonstration at the 2nd USA Science and Engineering Festival and will eventually expire.

When the app is activated, your GPS coordinates are recorded once every 10 seconds, and the coordinates are shared on the iSENSE website (isense.cs.uml.edu), where they can be viewed publicly. To make it easy for you to find your contributed data, the app prompts you to enter your first name and last initial. If you are not comfortable with your first name, last initial, and location being posted on the web, please refrain from using this application.

To begin recording and sharing data, press and hold the "Hold to Start" button. Data will be recorded and uploaded every 10 seconds (provided that the GPS on your mobile device has a satellite fix). When you are ready to stop recording, press and hold the "Hold to Stop" button. At that time, you will have the option to view the data live on the iSENSE web site.

While recording data, you will not be permitted to exit the app by pressing the Back button. However, pressing the Home button will stop recording. When the app resumes, a dialog box will appear indicating that data recording was halted.
Lat: waiting for GPS\nLong: waiting for GPS
